p: Some experimental studies have reported the anti-inflammatory and analgesic activities of the essential oil and biologically active terpenes such as carnosic acid, carnosol, ursolic acid and betulinic acid, as well as rosmarinic acid, rosmanol and oleanolic acid [ 82]. In fact, it has been reported that they have antinociceptive activity, and that each individual triterpene showed a similar potency to that observed with ketorolac, a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug [ 82, 104].
